metadata.name: Dragon Stone
metadata.description:
Dragon Stone is a unique and imaginative work that combines elements of both nature and culture. The depiction of the Japanese town at night, the dragon statue, and the living one, all evoke different associations and connotations. The city represents the built environment and human civilization, while the dragon statue and living one both suggest a connection to the natural world and to mythical and spiritual themes.

The artworks explore the relationship between humanity and the natural world, and the ways in which these seemingly opposing forces can coexist and interact. The dragon is seen as a symbol of the natural world, while the little town represents the human world. The living dragon is a metaphor for the way in which these two worlds intersect and influence one another, the way that these two opposing forces can coexist and influence each other, and the importance of finding balance between them.
